ARABIC: أَوَأَمِنَ أَهْلُ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ أَن يَأْتِيَهُم بَأْسُنَا ضُحًى وَهُمْ يَلْعَبُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Or do the people of the cities feel secure against Our violent force coming down on them in the day while they are playing games?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Or, are the people of the towns so unafraid that (even when) Our retribution comes upon them in the hours of the morning they remain engrossed in sport and play?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Or, do the people of those towns feel secure that Our punishment will not come to them by daylight while they are at play?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: or that which could seize them during their busy hours of the day?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Or do the people of the dwellings not fear that Our wrath may come upon them during the day, while they are playing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Or, did the people of the towns then feel secure against the coming of Our punishment in the forenoon while they were playing
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: What! do the people of the towns feel secure from Our punishment coming to them in the morning while they play?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Do the people of the cities feel secure Our might shall not come upon them in daylight while they are playing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Or are the people of the townships then secure from the coming of Our wrath upon them in the daytime while they play?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Or, do they feel secure against the coming of Our punishment upon them in the forenoon while they are at play?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Or, are the people of the township secure that Our wrath would not come upon them by daylight while they are disporting themselves?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Do the people of the towns feel secure from Our punishment overtaking them at midday while they are playing around?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Or else did they feel secure against its coming in broad daylight while they played about (care-free)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Or, did the people of the towns then feel secure against the coming of Our Punishment in the forenoon while they play?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Or do the inhabitants of the villages feel secure from Our Might coming to them in the midmorning while they play?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Do the people of the towns feel secure that Our might will not come upon them by day, while they play?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Or did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them in the morning while they were at play?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [7:98] Or, do the people of the towns feel secure from the coming of Our might upon them in the daytime while they are playing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Or are the people of the townships then secure from the coming of Our wrath upon them in the daytime while they play) i.e. engaging in falsehood?
